title: Calories in Bourbon
meta_description: Discover calories in bourbon per standard serving, plus full nutrition breakdown including alcohol content and serving tips for mindful drinking.
assumptions: 80-proof (40% ABV) bourbon whiskey, straight serving, no mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by proof, brand, distillation, and serving size. Alcohol content affects calorie density. Consult labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard 1.5 fl oz shot of 80-proof bourbon contains about 97 calories, all from alcohol.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts style; bourbon provides empty calories from ethanol with no macros.

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of bourbon?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal in a 1.5 fl oz shot of 80-proof bourbon.

faqs.q: Does bourbon have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No—straight bourbon has 0 g carbs, fiber, or sugars; calories are purely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in bourbon?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more alcohol and calories; e.g., 100-proof adds ~16 kcal per 1.5 oz over 80-proof.

faqs.q: Calories in bourbon vs. other whiskeys?
faqs.a: Similar for straight whiskeys at same proof; bourbon's corn base doesn't add significant calories.
Yes, compared to sugary cocktails, but it's empty calories—opt for straight shots to minimize intake.
